mods.abstract: A group of amusing opera goers dominate the fore and center ground of the picture plane. They stand against the neoclassical backdrop of the walls six fluted columns. Between each pair of columns there are French doors with fan lights above. Occupying the foreground are two middle aged ladies. The one on the right is almost in the center of the picture and she has turned her head to the right providing a profile view of her head. Her hair is very carefully arranged in a short layered cut and her dress has a mantel of layers of lace. She wears large earrings and a necklace that looks like a series of conjoining beetles. The other foreground lady occupies the right quadrant of the image and has her left shoulder turned to the picture plane. Her dress has ruffled puff sleeves, her hair is short and tightly curled and she wears long earrings. She is speaking to a large middle aged man who has along salt and pepper grey hair that is swept back. He has long sideburns, a thin moustache, sad turned down eyes and a cleft chin. He wears, a colorful tunic or Nehru type jacket which is patterned in a vertical rectangular shapes. He wears a large chain with large ring pendant around his neck. In the left quadrant There is a bald headed black man wearing wire frame glasses in profile looking toward the left. He wears a plaid jacket, big neck cloth and his shirt has ruffled sleeves.
mods.note: This print was inspired by the artist's visit to the then newly restored opera house in San Miguel Allende, Mexico, in 1971.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art
